intro: Vellereophyton lasianthum, commonly known as the Madagascar starflower, is a member of the Gentianaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the island of Madagascar, characterized by its striking star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in a fine, velvety texture, giving it its genus name. The flowers, which bloom in late winter to early spring, are blue to purple in color and attract various pollinators.
